transportAdvice: Valletta's compact historic centre is highly walkable, though its steep hills and cobblestone streets can be tiring; a free government-operated lift connects the lower and upper parts of the city. A public bus network covers Valletta and most of the island, making it easy to reach other towns and beaches without a car, and taxis are widely available for longer or more convenient journeys.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally rainy with mild temperatures, making it a quiet but pleasant time for sightseeing.
Similar to January with cool days and some rain, though sunny spells are common and crowds remain low.
Temperatures begin to rise and days grow longer, with a mix of sunshine and occasional showers.
Warm and mostly sunny with very little rain, ideal for exploring the city and surrounding areas.
Pleasantly warm and dry with long sunny days, marking the start of the busy tourist season.
Hot and reliably sunny with very little rainfall, great for combining city visits with beach days.
Peak summer heat with intense sunshine and virtually no rain; early morning sightseeing is advisable.
The hottest month of the year, very sunny and humid, with the island at its busiest.
Still warm and mostly sunny with the sea at its warmest, though occasional storms can develop late in the month.
Comfortable temperatures and a mix of sun and rain as autumn sets in, with noticeably fewer tourists.
Mild and increasingly unsettled with more frequent rain, but still warm enough for comfortable outdoor exploration.
Cool and occasionally wet with a festive atmosphere in the city, and quieter conditions for visiting attractions.
